title: Integrated Stimulus-Adjusted Teaching Methodology for Early Intervention in Autism

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in special education or speech-language therapy, understanding characteristics of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, emphasizing daily life-integrated intervention strategies

learning_goals: In integrated learning environments, learners can design and implement methods to progressively adjust stimulus complexity based on autistic children’s response levels.
Learners can develop personalized intervention plans combining Natural Environment Tasks (NET) with digital tools (e.g., tablets).
Learners can apply protocols to analyze children’s performance data and adjust stimulus presentation in real time.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
